page.title: 11THE RIVERS OF LANGHOLM
page.content: THE {RIVER ESK},WHICH FLOWS THROUGH { {LANGHOLM},IS THE REASON WHY THE MILLS AND THE{'SKINYARD'(FELLMONGERY)}ARE SITUATED ALONG ITS BANKS.THE WATER WAS USED BY THE LOCAL{WOOLLEN INDUSTRY } FOR POWER AND FOR WASHING THE WOOL.THE {EWES} TRIBUTARY JOINS THE ESK AT THE KILNGREEN, WHICH IS A CARAVAN SITE/CAR PARK, ABOVE THE LANGHOLM BRIDGE.THE { {WAUCHOPE}TRIBUTARY RUNS PAST THE PARK AND UNDER THE CHURCH BRIDGE TO JOIN THE ESK.THE RIVER HAS SOME DEEP POOLS,BUT ALSO SHALLOW PLACES WHERE IT WAS FORDED LONG AGO.THE RIVER IS CLEAN ENOUGH FOR CHILDREN TO SWIM IN IT IN THE SUMMER. FAMILIES PICNIC ALONG ITS BANKS AND FEED THE DUCKS.{ANGLERS}FISH FOR{SALMON AND TROUT}.THE MAIN A7 ROAD RUNS ALONG BESIDE THE RIVER.
